reactor.core.dispatch

Class ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.core.dispatch.AbstractLifecycleDispatcher
      • reactor.core.dispatch.MultiThreadDispatcher
        • reactor.core.dispatch.ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, Dispatcher, Resource

    public class ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher
extends MultiThreadDispatcher
    A Dispatcher that uses a ThreadPoolExecutor with an unbounded queue to dispatch events.
    Author:
    Andy Wilkinson, Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher

        public ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher(int poolSize,
                                    int backlog)
        Creates a new ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher with the given poolSize and backlog. By default, a RejectedExecutionHandler is created which runs the submitted Runnable in the calling thread. To change this behavior, specify your own.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - the pool size
        backlog - the backlog size

      • ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher

        public ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher(int poolSize,
                                    int backlog,
                                    String threadName)
        Create a new ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher with the given size, backlog, name, and RejectedExecutionHandler.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - the pool size
        backlog - the backlog size
        threadName - the name prefix to use when creating threads

      • ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher

        public ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher(int poolSize,
                                    int backlog,
                                    String threadName,
                                    BlockingQueue<Runnable> workQueue,
                                    RejectedExecutionHandler rejectedExecutionHandler)
        Create a new ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher with the given size, backlog, name, and RejectedExecutionHandler.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - the pool size
        backlog - the backlog size
        threadName - the name prefix to use when creating threads
        rejectedExecutionHandler - the RejectedExecutionHandler to use when jobs can't be submitted to the thread pool

      • ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher

        public ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher(int backlog,
                                    int poolSize,
                                    ExecutorService executor)
        Create a new ThreadPoolTaskExecutor with the given backlog and ExecutorService.
        Parameters:
        backlog - the task backlog
        poolSize - the number of threads
        executor - the executor to use to execute tasks

      • awaitAndShutdown

        public boolean awaitAndShutdown(long timeout,
                                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Block until all submitted tasks have completed, then do a normal Resource.shutdown().

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used. If the resource carries any work, it will wait for all the remaining tasks to perform before closing the resource.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Resource
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher

      • forceShutdown

        public void forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.
        Specified by:
        forceShutdown in interface Resource
        Overrides:

      • remainingSlots

        public long remainingSlots()
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Request the remaining capacity for the underlying shared state structure. E.g. RingBufferDispatcher will return RingBuffer.remainingCapacity().

        Returns:
        the remaining capacity if supported otherwise it returns a negative value.
